sen.j: 大石 良勝 （おおいし よしかつ、天正15年（1587年） - 慶安3年8月23日 (旧暦)（1650年9月18日））は、安土桃山時代・江戸時代初期の武士。
sen.e: Yoshikatsu OISHI (1587 - September 18, 1650) was a samurai in the Azuchi-Momoyama/early Edo period.
Yoshikatsu OISHI (1587 - September 18, 1650) was a samurai in the Azuchi-Momoyama to early Edo period.
Yoshikatsu OISHI (1587 - September 18, 1650) was a samurai who lived from the Azuchi-Momoyama period to the early Edo period.
sen.cmt: 「安土桃山時代から江戸時代初期までの」という意味に解釈しました。

sen.j: 常陸国笠間藩浅野家の筆頭家老。
sen.e: He was the head of chief retainers of the Asano family of Kasama domain in Hitachi Province.

He was the head of chief retainers of the Asano family of Kasama Domain in Hitachi Province.

sen.j: 忠臣蔵で有名な大石良雄の曽祖父。
sen.e: He was the great grandfather of Yoshio OISHI, a person famous for "Chushingura" (The Treasury of Loyal Rtainers).
He was the great grandfather of Yoshio OISHI, famous for "Chushingura" (The Treasury of Loyal Retainers).
sen.cmt: a person を削除し、 Rtainers→Retainers と修正しました。
sen.e: He was the great grandfather of Yoshio OISHI, famous for "Chushingura" (The Treasury of Loyal Retainers).

sen.j: 通称は内蔵助（くらのすけ）・新七郎（しんしちろう）・五左衛門（ござえもん）。
sen.e: His common names were Kuranosuke, Shinshichiro and Gozaemon.

sen.j: 関白豊臣秀次の家臣大石良信の次男として誕生。
sen.e: He was the second son of Yoshinobu OISHI, a vassal of Kanpaku (chief advisor to the Emperor) Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI.
He was born as the second son of Yoshinobu OISHI, a vassal of Kanpaku (chief advisor to the Emperor) Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI.
sen.cmt: born as を補いました。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Yoshinobu OISHI, a vassal of Kanpaku (chief advisor to the Emperor) Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 母は近衛家家臣の進藤長治の娘志茂。
sen.e: His mother was Shimo, a daughter of Choji SHINDO, a vassal of Konoe family.
His mother was Shimo, a daughter of Choji SHINDO, a vassal of the Konoe family.

sen.j: 兄に大石良照、弟に大石信云（47士の1人大石信清の祖父）がいる。
sen.e: Yoshiteru OISHI was his older brother and Nobukoto OISHI (the grandfather of Nobukiyo OISHI, one of shijushichishi (47 loyal retainers of Chushingura)) was his younger brother.
Yoshiteru OISHI was his older brother and Nobukoto OISHI (the grandfather of Nobukiyo OISHI, one of the shijushichishi [47 loyal retainers of Chushingura]) was his younger brother.
sen.cmt: the を挿入しました。カッコを修正しました。

sen.j: 庶子であるがために良勝ははじめ僧侶にされる予定で、石清水八幡宮の宮本坊に入れられていた。
sen.e: As he was born out of wedlock, Yoshikatsu was supposed to become a monk and entered Miyamotobo of Iwashimizu Hachimangu Shrine.

sen.j: 本人は僧侶になることを嫌がり、慶長5年（1600年）に京都を脱走して江戸の浪人となった。
sen.e: He, however, disliked to become a monk, escaped from Kyoto in 1600 and became a ronin (lordless samurai) in Edo.

sen.j: 慶長9年（1604年）、18歳の頃に浅野長政三男浅野長重（当時は下野国真岡藩主2万石で後に常陸国真壁藩5万石を経て常陸国笠間藩5万3千石）に仕える。
sen.e: In 1604 when he was 18 years old, he started to serve for Nagamasa ASANO' third son Nagashige ASANO (the lord of Moka domain of 20,000 goku (1 koku is about 18litter) in Shimotsuke Province at the time, later became the lord of Makabe domain of 50,000 goku in Hitachi Province followed by the lord of Kasama domain of 53,000 goku in Hitachi Province).

sen.j: はじめは300石の小姓であったが、元和 (日本)元年（1615年）の大坂夏の陣における天王寺・岡山の戦いでは著しい武功をあげたため、1500石の筆頭家老となった。
sen.e: He was initially a kosho (pageboy) of 300 koku, but he rendered distinguished military service in the battle of Tennoji/Okayama of the Osaka Natsu no Jin (Summer Siege of Osaka) in 1615 and became the head of the chief retainers of 1,500 koku.

sen.j: また良勝の子孫も代々筆頭家老の地位を約束されるという永代家老家とされた。
sen.e: Further, his family became the family of permanent chief retainer and the successive descendants of Yoshikatsu were promised to become the head of the chief retainers.

sen.j: 慶安3年（1650年）8月23日に京都において死去。
sen.e: He died in Kyoto on September 18, 1650.

sen.j: 伯父にあたる大石良定の三女を妻に迎え、息子に大石良欽（赤穂藩浅野家筆頭家老）、大石良重（赤穂藩浅野家家老）、奥村具知（富山藩松平家家臣）、小山良秀（赤穂藩浅野家家臣・小山良師の養父）、大石良次（高松松平家家臣）の五人を儲けた。
sen.e: He married the third daughter of his uncle Yoshisada OISHI and had five sons; Yoshitaka OISHI (the head of chief retainers of Asano family of Ako domain), Yoshishige OISHI (a chief retainer of Asano family of Ako domain), Tomotomo OKUMURA (a vassal of Matsudaira family of Toyama domain), Yoshihide Koyama (a vassal of Asano family of Ako domain, adoptive father of Yoshikazu KOYAMA) and Yoshitsugu OISHI (a vassal of Matsudaira family of Takamatsu domain).
